</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.05</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name> mp</name>=<value> On a client the command will return empty arrays for every unit that is not local. On the server the command correctly returns the role, regardless of the units locality.

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>Returns the role a unit is assigned to within its assigned vehicle.

<br><br>
'''Notes:'''
* When an unit enters a vehicle crew position, it gets assigned the vehicle role automatically for the given crew position.
* The unit does not have to be in the vehicle when getting the role assignment (ie via assignAsXXX or human/AI GL getIn radio commands).
* GL getIn radio commands result in instant assignment - the unit does not yet have to occupy the crew position.
* Dying units will let go of the assigned role after a few seconds - seems the delay is independent of being in the vehicle or not.
* An unit will hold on to its assigned role after exiting the vehicle.
* One has to use [[unassignVehicle]] (and stop an AI GL to assign vehicle positions again) or [[leaveVehicle]] to remove the assignment - or assigned to another vehicle.
* A vehicle position/role can only be assigned to one unit at a time. So even when not (visually) occupied, the "seat" may be blocked/reserved by another unit. 
* A player can still get into the vehicle position already assigned if not already taken, or switch seats with AI (if [[leader]] or [[effectiveCommander]] for those AI).
</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''assignedVehicleRole''' unitName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  unitName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - The array which is returned contains:<br>
* [] - Not assigned to any vehicle
* ["driver"] - Assigned as driver
* ["cargo"] (or ["cargo", [turret path]] since Arma 3 1.31.127272) - Assigned as cargo
* ["turret", [turret path]] - Assigned to a turret</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_RoleArray = [[assignedVehicleRole]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
